Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ball

  • public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
    Version Information:

    Author Chua Hock-Chuan, Esther Yoo Version # 1 Date 05.02.16 Time Spent 1 hour

    Version:
    1.1 05.22.16 The Ball class is a data class

    Instance variables:

    x A float variable that stores the Ball's center x-coordinate.

    y A float variable that stores the Ball's center y-coordinate.

    speedX A float variable that stores the Ball's x speed.

    speedY A float variable that stores the Ball's y speed.

    radius A float variable that stores the Ball's radius.

    letter A char variable that stores the letter the bubble is holding.

    wasClicked A boolean variable that checks if the bubble was clicked.

    angleInDegree A float variable that stores the angle the ball is moving at.

    color A Color variable that stores the colour of the ball.

    outline A Color variable that stores the colour of the ball's outline.

    letterCol A Color variable that stores the ball's letter colour.

    Author:
    Esther Yoo, Chua Hock-Chuan for original graphics code, modifed by Esther Yoo.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(float x,
            float y,
            float radius,
            float speed,
            float angleInDegree,
            java.awt.Color color,
            char letter,
            boolean wasClicked)
        The class constructor assigns all the values passed in its parameter to the appropriate instance variables. x, y, angleInDegree, radius, color, letter, and wasClicked are determined by their respective parameter passes. speedX and speedY are calculated using the speed passed in.
        Parameters:
        x - This float type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level x variable as the x-coordinate.
        y - This float type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level y variable as the y-coordinate.
        radius - This float type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level radius variable as the radius.
        speed - This float type parameter pass is used to calulate speeds and assigned to the instance-level speedX and speedY variables as the speed.
        angleInDegree - This float type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level angleInDegree variable as the angle the bubble moves at.
        color - This Color type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level color variable as the bubble's interior colour.
        letter - This char type parameter pass represents the letter the bubble will contain.
        wasClicked - This boolean type parameter pass keeps track of whether the bubble was clicked or not.

    • Method Detail

        public void setLocation(int x,
                        int y)
        The setLocation method is a mutator method that sets the x and y coordinates of the bubble, determined by their respective parameter passes.
        Parameters:
        x - This integer type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level x variable as the new x-coordinate.
        y - This integer type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level y variable as the new y-coordinate.

        Returns:

      • setWasClicked

        public void setWasClicked(boolean newWasClicked)
        The setWasClicked method is a mutator method that sets the wasClicked value of the bubble, determined by its parameter pass.
        Parameters:
        newWasClicked - This boolean type parameter pass is assigned to the instance-level wasClicked variable as the new wasClicked.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The draw method draws the bubble on the panel. First, the colour is set to the instance variable, color.

        Then, the bubble is drawn according to its x-coordinate, y-coordinate, and radius, as specified by the instance variables.

        Next, the colour is set to the instance variable, outline.

        Then, the bubble is outlined according to its x-coordinate, y-coordinate, and radius, as specified by the instance variables.

        Next, the colour is set to the instance variable, letterCol.

        The font is set to regular "Comic Sans MS", and size 70. Then, the letter is drawn inside the bubble according to the bubble's x-coordinate and y-coordinate, as specified by the instance variables.

        Parameters:
        g - This parameter pass is used to access the Graphics class.

      • returnVerticalCenter

        public float returnVerticalCenter()
        The returnVerticalCenter method is an accessor method that returns the value of the vertical center of the bubble.
        Returns:
        y This is a float variable that stores the bubble's center y-coordinate.

      • returnHorizontalCenter

        public float returnHorizontalCenter()
        The returnHorizontalCenter method is an accessor method that returns the value of the horizontal center of the bubble.
        Returns:
        x This is a float variable that stores the bubble's center x-coordinate.

      • getLetter

        public char getLetter()
        The getLetter method is an accessor method that returns the letter the bubble contains.
        Returns:
        letter This is a float variable that stores the bubble's center x-coordinate.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color newColor)
        The setColor method is a mutator method that sets the value of the color variable of the bubble, determined by its parameter pass.
        Parameters:

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(float speed)
        The setSpeed method is a mutator method that sets the value of the speedX and speedY variables of the bubble, determined by its parameter pass.
        Parameters:
        speed - This float type parameter pass is used to calculate speeds and assign new values to the instance-level speedX and speedY variables as the new speeds.

      • moveOneStepWithCollisionDetection

        public void moveOneStepWithCollisionDetection(ContainerBox box)
        The setSpeed moveOneStepWithCollisionDetection method checks if the ball is going over the bounds of its ContainerBox and adjusts its position and speed accordingly. First, the ballMinX, ballMinY, ballMaxX, and ballMaxY are calulated and assigned according to the radius of the ball and the ContainerBox's bounds. This gets the ball's bounds.

        Next, the ball's new position is calculated and assigned according to its speed.

        Then, the if statement checks whether the ball is over the bounds of the box's x-coordinates. If so, its position and speed are adjusted.

        The last if statement checks whether the ball is over the bounds of the box's y-coordinates. If so, its position and speed are adjusted.

        Parameters:
        box - This ContainerBox type parameter pass tells the method which box the bubble is in and what numbers to work with in order to prevent the bubble from going out of bounds.
